title: Renée Slegers - Wikipedia
snippet: Renée Josiena Anna Slegers (Dutch: [rəˈneː joːˈsinaː ˈʔɑnaː ˈsleːɣərs]; born 5 February 1989) is a Dutch football coach and former player, who is the head coach of Women's Super League club Arsenal.

title: Arsenal Women Long-Read: The making of Renee Slegers Arsenal Manager - Arseblog News - the Arsenal news site
snippet: In January, Arsenal appointed 35-year-old Dutch coach Renee Slegers as the Head Coach of their women’s team after a spell as Interim Manager that saw the Gunners win 10 and draw one of her 11 games in temporary charge.

title: Renee Slegers: The player, the coach and the person behind the Arsenal boss - BBC Sport
snippet: Just like at Rosengard, Slegers has worked her way up the ladder at Arsenal - first becoming Eidevall's assistant, and then taking interim charge when he resigned in October after a disappointing start to the season. Her impact was instant. She went unbeaten in her first 11 games in charge - a run of fixtures that proved to be an almost-perfect audition for the permanent position. "Renee came in she steadied the ship," Arsenal left-back Katie McCabe said.

title: Renée Slegers on her journey from Arsenal academy player to Women's Champions League finalist coach | UEFA Women's Champions League 2024/25 | UEFA.com
snippet: ... The last time Arsenal featured ... Women's Cup), Renée Slegers was a fresh-faced 18-year-old midfielder who was just coming to the end of a valuable year spent at the club's academy....

title: Renée Sleger's Net Worth, Ethnicity, Partner and Personal Life
snippet: Renée Slegers was born on February 5, 1989, in Someren-Eind, a small town in the Netherlands’ Noord-Brabant province. Her ethnicity is Dutch, rooted in the cultural and historical context of the Netherlands. The Dutch are a Germanic ethnic group native to the region, with a heritage shaped by centuries of maritime trade, cultural exchange, and a strong national identity.
